42.heading: Walt Disney Home Entertainment.
42.title: The Lion King.
42.author: [No author]

publication info.publisher: Walt Disney Home Entertainment : Buena Vista Home Entertainment

notes: Originally released as a motion picture in 1994.

Summary (from OCLC): Simba begins life as an honored prince, son of the powerful King Mufasa. The cub's happy childhood turns tragic when his evil uncle Scar murders Mufasa and drives Simba away from the kingdom. In exile, the young lion befriends the comically bumbling pair of Pumbaa the warthog and Timon the meerkat and lives a carefree jungle life. As he approaches adulthood, however, he is visited by the spirit of his father, who instructs him to defeat the nefarious Scar and reclaim his rightful throne.
Library has book only intended to accompany a set of 2 DVDs.

43.heading: Walt Disney Home Video.
43.title: Crimebusters [videorecording]
43.author: The Walt Disney Company.

publication info.publisher: Walt Disney Home Video : Distributed by Buena Vista Home Video

notes: Summary: Catteries not included: Chip and Dale are called in to solve the case of the catnapped kitten. The Rescue Rangers find it a tough nut to crack when nutty Professor Nimnul and his giant robot bulldogs weave a diabolical plot of cat-astrophic proportions.
Sumary: Piratsy under the seas: While hunting for sunken treasure, Rescue Ranger Dale finds himself in need of rescuing from a gang of sea pi-rats and Billy the Squid.

publication info.publisher: Walt Disney Home Video : Distributed by Buena Vista Home Video

46.heading: Walt Disney Home Video.
46.title: One Hundred and One Dalmatians [videorecording]
46.author: [No author]
notes: At head of title: Walt Disney Presents.
Originally produced as motion picture in 1961.

Summary (from OCLC): Dalmatians Pongo and Perdita settle into their owners' flat in London to become proud parents of 15 precocious pups. It's one big happy dog family until the evil Cruella De Vil kidnaps the puppies, along with every other Dalmatian in the city. It's up to Pongo and Perdita to unite the entire animal population in a mission to help the courageous pups outsmart their captor.

47.heading: Walt Disney Home Video.
47.title: Pinocchio [videorecording]
47.author: [No author]
notes: Title on container: Walt Disney's Masterpiece Pinocchio.
Based on the story by Carlo Collodi.
Videocassette release of the 1940 animated film by Walt Disney Productions.
Directors, Ben Sharpsteen, Hamilton Luske ; story adaptation, Ted Sears, et al. ; animation, Jack Campbell, et al. ; music and lyrics by Leigh Harline, Ned Washington, Paul J. Smith.
Characters: Pinocchio, Jiminy Cricket, Geppetto, J. Worthington Foulfellow, Monstro.

Summary (from OCLC): A puppet wants to be a boy. A fairy promises boyhood to Pinocchio if he can prove he is kind, honest and loving. A wayward huckster tries to lead the puppet astray but Pinocchio decides to perform a redeeming act of bravery and kindness.
